sentence.Network_en: He had been feeling drowsy, the effect of an unusually heavy meal.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一直感到昏昏沉沉的，这是吃了一顿超级大餐的结果。

sentence.Network_en: I felt dopey and drowsy after the operation.
sentence.Network_cn: 手术后我感到迷迷糊糊，昏昏欲睡。

sentence.Network_en: The tablets may make you feel drowsy.
sentence.Network_cn: 这药片可能会使你昏昏欲睡。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: probably from the stem of Old English drūsian 'be languid or slow', of Germanic origin; related to dreary

entry.def: If you feel drowsy, you feel sleepy and cannot think clearly.

example.ex: He felt pleasantly drowsy and had to fight off the urge to sleep.
example.tran: 他感觉昏昏欲睡，只好尽量克制睡意。

sentences.sentence: "it seemed a pity to disturb the drowsing (or dozing) professor"
"the nodding (or napping) grandmother in her rocking chair"

means.word_mean: 2. showing lack of attention or boredom;

auth_sentence.content: This causes the feeling of being drowsy or sleepy.
auth_sentence.res_content: This causes the feeling of being drowsy or sleepy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This causes the feeling of being drowsy or sleepy.

auth_sentence.content: The slow formality of an oblivious and drowsy exchequer.
auth_sentence.res_content: The slow formality of an oblivious and drowsy exchequer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The slow formality of an oblivious and drowsy exchequer.

auth_sentence.content: Drowsy and dazed with his narcotic but unable to sleep.
auth_sentence.res_content: Drowsy and dazed with his narcotic but unable to sleep.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Drowsy and dazed with his narcotic but unable to sleep.

means.word_mean: 欲睡的, 半睡的, 使人昏昏欲睡的

sentences.en: I feel drowsy after lunch every day.
sentences.cn: 每天午饭后我就想睡觉。
那是一个暖和、寂静而令人昏昏欲睡的下午。

sentences.en: Exhaust fumes made him drowsy and brought on a headache.
sentences.cn: 废气把他熏得昏昏沉沉，还引起了头疼。
